org.pentaho.pat.client.ui.widgets
Class DataWidget

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject

                      org.gwt.mosaic.ui.client.layout.LayoutPanel
                          org.pentaho.pat.client.ui.widgets.DataWidget
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IndexedPanel, java.lang.Iterable<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>, org.gwt.mosaic.ui.client.layout.HasLayoutManager
Direct Known Subclasses:
OlapPanel, WelcomePanel
public abstract class DataWidget
extends org.gwt.mosaic.ui.client.layout.LayoutPanel

A widget used to show the examples in the content panel. It includes a tab bar with options to view the example, view the source, or view the css style rules.

This widget uses a lazy initialization mechanism so that the content is not rendered until the onInitialize method is called, which happens the first time the widget is added to the page. The data in the source and css tabs are loaded using RPC call to the server.

CSS Style Rules

  • .mosaic-sc-Page { Applied to the entire widget }
  • .sc-ContentWidget-tabBar { Applied to the TabBar }
  • .sc-ContentWidget-deckPanel { Applied to the DeckPanel }
  • .sc-ContentWidget-name { Applied to the name }
  • .sc-ContentWidget-description { Applied to the description }

Author:
tom(at)wamonline.org.uk

onInitialize

protected abstract com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget onInitialize()
When the widget is first initialized, this method is called. If it returns a Widget, the widget will be added as the first tab. Return null to disable the first tab.

Returns:
the widget
